name: Jason Morphew
bio: Jason Morphew started life in a mobile home in Pike County, Arkansas. He earned a BA in English literature from Yale University and a PhD in English Renaissance literature from the University of California, Los Angeles. He is the author of the collection Dead Boy (2018) and the chapbooks What to deflect when you’re deflecting (2017) and In Order to Commit Suicide (2012). His poems have appeared in the Bellevue Literary Review, the Cortland Review, and Public Pool, among other journals, and his essays and reviews have appeared in the Los Angeles Review of Books, Outlook Springs, and Publishers Weekly. Morphew is also a singer-songwriter. He teaches at the University of California, Los Angeles, among other colleges and universities, and lives in Laurel Canyon, Los Angeles.
